intro: Chiococca rubriflora, commonly known as the red-flowered chiococca, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are typically borne in clusters at the ends of its branches. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
